intro: Epidendrum umbelliferum, commonly known as the Umbrella Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, racemose inflorescence that bears numerous small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and革质 (leathery), providing structural support for its aerial roots. The flowers, which range in color from white to pink and yellow, are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
